intro: Monoceras, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, single horn-shaped structure at the base of its flower, which is a unique botanical feature. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind.
